meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with nails.
meanings.sent1: He was nailing the picture frame to the wall.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys nailing the wooden planks together to build a birdhouse.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter was nailing so fast, he almost hit his thumb!
meanings.sent4: She was nailing her dance routine with precision and grace.
meanings.sent5: The sound of nailing echoed through the workshop, signaling progress.

meanings.sent1: The boxer was nailing his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent2: She was nailing the drum set during the performance.
meanings.sent3: He was nailing the target at the shooting range with impressive accuracy.
meanings.sent4: The storm was nailing the coast with strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The hammer came down, nailing the nail into the wood with a satisfying thud.

meanings.definition: To achieve success or accomplish something perfectly.
meanings.sent1: She was nailing her presentation and received a standing ovation.
meanings.sent2: He was nailing the recipe, creating the perfect dish.
meanings.sent3: The team was nailing their strategy, winning every game.
meanings.sent4: The artist was nailing the portrait, capturing every detail flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: After hours of practice, she was finally nailing the guitar solo.
